citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, the registrant did not have a written contingency plan in place. Contingency plans and
contingency training for personnel are required to help ensure animal health and well-being in the event of an emergency
or disaster. Without a contingency plan and training on that plan, personnel may not be aware of their roles and
responsibilities; animals may suffer illness, injury or death due to unpreparedness should an emergency or disaster strike.
The registrant must provide a written contingency plan and document training for its personnel regarding their roles and
responsibilities as outlined in the contingency plan and ensure that that new hires receive this training within 30 days of
their start date. The registrant must conduct and document a review of the plan at least once annually; any changes
made during this review must be communicated to employees through documented training within 30 days.
TO BE CORRECTED BY 05/11/2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
